name: reverberative
content:
reverberative adjective
(SOUND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A reverberative sound is one that continues to be heard around an area, so that the area seems to shake: The reverberative thumping of the machinery began to give me a headache. His deep, reverberative voice made him an impressive public speaker.
More examplesFewer examplesI find the reverberative strains of the church organ to be very uplifting.The acoustics of this room help to amplify the reverberative effect of the cello.The silence in the hall was almost reverberative, if silence can be said to reverberate.
